Description: The tissue which has free surface that faces either a body fluid or the outside environment is called characteristics of the
Options: Muscular tissue, Fluid connective tissue, Epithelial tissue, Nervous tissue

Description: Epithelial tissue is distinguished from connective tissue, muscular, or nervous tissue by its
Options: large extracellular matrix, contractibility, ability to carry action potentials, basement membrane

Description: The ciliated columnar epithelial cells in humans occur in
Options: Eustachian tube and stomach lining, bronchioles and fallopian tubes, bile duct and oesophagus, fallopian tubes and urethra

Description: The squamous epithelium is found in
Options: stomach, intestine, trachea, air sacs of lungs

Description: The kind of epithelium which forms the inner walls of blood vessels is
Options: cuboidal epithelium, columnar epithelium, ciliated columnar epithelium, squamous epithelium

Description: Which of the following type of cell junction is not found in animal tissues?
Options: Adhering junction, Tight junction, Gap junction, Plasmodesmata

Description: Which of the following statement is incorrect regarding cuboidal epithelium?
Correct Answer: They are found in the walls of blood vessels and air sacs of lungs.
Options: It is an epithelial tissue, It is composed of a single layer of cube-like cells., They are found in the walls of blood vessels and air sacs of lungs., Secretion and absorption are the main functions of these tissue.

Description: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct  regarding compound epithelium?
Options: It is made of more than one layer of cells and thus has a limited role in secretion and absorption., Their main function is to provide protection against chemical and mechanical stresses., They cover the dry surface of the skin, moist surface of buccal cavity, pharynx, inner lining of ducts of salivary glands and pancreatic ducts., All of the above

Description: Ciliated simple columnar epithelium often contains _________,which increase the surface area for secretion and absorption.
Options: flagella, collagen fibres, microvilli, all of these

Description: A student was given a sample of two tissues. He observes the tissues under the microscope and draws their figures (1 and 2) as shown below. Identify the tissues (1 and 2).
Correct Answer: 1. Columnar cells bearing cilia; 2: Multicellular glandular epithelium
Options: 1: Columnar cells bearing cilia: 2: Unicellular glandular epithelium, 1: Cuboidal cells bearing cilia: 2: Multicellular glandular epithelium, 1: Compound cells bearing cilia; 2: Unicellular glandular epithelium, 1. Columnar cells bearing cilia; 2: Multicellular glandular epithelium

Description: Which of the following statement(s) regarding cell junctions is/are correct?
Options: Tight junctions help to stop substances from leaking across a tissue., Adhering junctions perform cementing to keen neighbouring cells together., All of the above, Gap junctions facilitate the cells to communicate With each other by connecting the cytoplasm adjoining cells, for rapid transfer of ions small molecules and sometimes big molecules

Description: Choose the correctly matched pair
Correct Answer: Tubular parts of nephrons - Cuboidal epithelium
Options: Inner lining of salivary ducts - Ciliated epithelium, Moist surface of buccal cavity - Glandular epithelium, Tubular parts of nephrons - Cuboidal epithelium, Inner surface of bronchioles - Squamous epithelium

Description: The function of the gap junction is to:
Correct Answer: facilitate communication between adjoining cells by connecting the cytoplasm for rapid transfer of ions, small molecules and some large molecules
Options: separate two cells from each other, stop substance from leaking across a tissue, performing cementing to keep neighbouring cells together, facilitate communication between adjoining cells by connecting the cytoplasm for rapid transfer of ions, small molecules and some large molecules

Description: The only type of cell seen in a tendon is
Options: muscle fibres, reticular cells, collagenous cells, fibroblasts

Description: Tendons and ligaments are the examples of
Options: areolar connective tissue, adipose tissue, dense regular connective tissue, loose connective tissue

Description: Which of the following statement is incorrect regarding cuboidal epithelium?
Correct Answer: They are found in the walls of blood vessels and air sacs of lungs

Description: What are the three basic components of connective tissues ?
Correct Answer: Cells, protein fibers and ground substance
Options: Ground substance, cells and basement membrane, Cartilage, intercellular matrix and serum, Cells, protein fibers and ground substance, Collagen, elastin and reticular fibers

Description: The major functions of loose connective tissue include
Options: occupying spaces between organs and supporting epithelia, supporting and surrounding blood vessels and nerves, cushioning organs, storing lipids and facilitating diffusion, All of the above

Description: Which one is the characteristic of epithelial tissue?
Correct Answer: The cells will have a rapid rate of cell division.
Options: Tissues are highly vascularised., These cells never produce glands., The cells will have a rapid rate of cell division., Large intercellular spaces are seen between cells.

Description: What will happen if ligaments are cut or broken?
Options: No movements at joints., Bones will become fixed, Bones will become unfixed., Bone will move freely at joints.

Description: The supportive skeletal structures in the human external ears and in the nose tip are examples of
Options: ligament, areolar tissue, bone, cartilage

Description: Which of the following types of connective tissue is mismatched with its matrix?
Options: Areolar - Loosely packed matrix of protein fibres, Bone - Mineralized matrix, Cartilage - Highly vascular matrix, Blood - Liquid matrix

Description: The protein present in the matrix of cartilage is
Options: Chitin, Chondrin, Ossein, Chondriotin

Description: The camel's hump is composed of a tissue which provides water when oxidized. It is:
Options: Skeletal tissue, Areolar tissue, Adipose tissue, Muscular tissue

Description: The function of the gap junction is to
Correct Answer: facilitate communication between adjoining cells by connecting the cytoplasm for rapid transfer of ions, small molecules and some large molecules
Options: separate two cells from each other, stop substance from leaking across a tissue., performing cementing to keep neighbouring cells together, facilitate communication between adjoining cells by connecting the cytoplasm for rapid transfer of ions, small molecules and some large molecules

Description: Choose the correctly matched pair.
Options: Tendon-Specialized connective tissue, Adipose tissue - Dense connective tissue, Areolar tissue - Loose connective tissue, Cartilage-Loose connective tissue

Description: Muscle tissue cells are contractile, which means they
Correct Answer: are specialized in contraction and relaxation

Options: cardiac muscles, striped muscles, adipose tissue, nerve and striated muscles

Description: Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct about muscle tissue?
Options: Each muscle is made of many long, cylindrical fibres arranged in parallel arrays., Muscle fibres contract (shorten) in response to stimulation, then relax (lengthen) and return to their uncontracted state in a coordinated fashion, Muscles play an active role in all movements of the body, All of the above

Description: Three essential components of most neurons are
Options: simple epithelium, extracellular matrix and nerves., axon, dendrites and cell body., nerve cells, synapse and neuroglia., mylein sheeth, node of Ranvier and Schwann cells

Description: Neuroglia are
Correct Answer: supporting and non-protecting cells of neural tissue
Options: excitable cells of neural tissue., supporting and non-protecting cells of neural tissue, two to three times in volume of neural tissue, protective and excitable cells of neural tissue

Description: Nervous tissue cells that play several supporting roles but do not transmit impulses are called
Options: glial cells, dendrites, nerve cells, neurons

Description: Which of the following statements Is not correct regarding neural tissue ?
Correct Answer: Chondrocytes, the unit of neural system are excitable cells.
Options: it exerts the greatest control over the body's responsiveness to changing conditions., Chondrocytes, the unit of neural system are excitable cells., Neuroglial cells protect and support neurons., When a neuron is suitably stimulated, an electrical disturbance is generated.

Options: into the skin surface, into the blood stream, into a gland duct, into the brain tissue

Correct Answer: Study of morphology of internal organs in the animal

Description: General function of gland is to
Correct Answer: produce and secrete specialized compounds to control and maintain different body functions

A, B, C,D

 Reason (R) : Gap junctions facilitate the cells to communicate with each other
